channel.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
channel.description: I’ve asked this question to myself many times and thinking about it a lot, I wanna know the reason, I can’t create other genres. Every time I open Auxy I want to make a funky beat but I end up making Ambient every single time.. I want to hear some opinions, how do I get into other genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
+1 on all accounts. It’d be like forcing yourself to speak with a fake accent - use your real voice. It’s always going to shine through no matter what anyway.

When people are first learning, they’re going to experiment with a ton of different genres. Eventually, you’ll use other other genres to influence your sound, but you’ll integrate those elements into what is your sound.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: xavior
item.description:
I agree with @akabillposters. I personally find it best to harness and hone what comes to us intrinsically. Some people struggle to find their definitive style and others struggle to branch out. Perhaps, before trying to move on to other genres, you can learn to develop and perfect your skills in ambient music.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: PISTOL
item.description:
I pretty much make dnb a majority of the time but that’s because I love dnb and I enjoy making it, I don’t think it’s a problem focussing mainly on one genre.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Why would you want to make other genres (if you’re not already doing it instinctively and it’s a struggle)?

Seems like Ambient is your authentic sound? Go with it.
Focus on that, develop that and make great Ambient music.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: Graye
item.description:
I mean just do it
Like watch a tutorial u can’t expect to make something without knowing how

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: Zeph
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Do you start with your drums? Also, try using instruments that you’re unfamiliar with — perhaps turn the reverb down/off and use sounds that cut a little harder.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?

item.title: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
item.dc:creator: LimeZ
item.description:
Just practice. Practice until you like what you hear and it sounds like you want.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I Have Problem Making other Genres?
